content.description:
The figure is labeled "Graph of f". The x axis ranges from 0 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no ticks marks and no scale.

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window near the positive y axis.

The curve decreases sharply to reach the labeled point (2 comma 10).

The curve continues to decrease to the labeled point (3 comma 5).

The curve continues to decrease to become nearly horizontal as it approaches the x axis.

The figure shows the graph of an exponential decay function <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math>. The coordinates of two of the points are labeled.
content.question: If <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, what is the <math alttext="y"> <mi>y</mi> </math>-coordinate of the point on the graph where <math alttext="x equals 0"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math> ?

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
